title: ISPGR workshop // Bridging the Gap - Best Practices in Mobile Brain Imaging
text:
Welcome to workshop website.







The workshop will be held on the 28th of June in Maastricht.


The day will consist of presentations, hands-on sessions and discussions. We will cover:



Time
Topic
Speaker(s)
Description
Slides




9:00
Introduction
Vivian Weerdesteyn
Intro to mobile brain imaging and its potential.
Slides


9:05
Multimodal setups
Sue Peters, Julius Welzel, Vaishali Vinod
Overview of EEG and fNIRS data synchronization with LSL.
Slides


9:40
Data collection
Konstantinos Tsikrikis, Joris van der Cruijsen, Julius Welzel, Vaishali Vinod, Natalie Richer
Hands-on mobile fNIRS or EEG data collection in combination with other modalities.
Slides


10:30
Break





10:45
Data (pre-)processing
Konstantinos Tsikrikis, Joris van der Cruijsen, Julius Welzel
Example data (pre-)processing.
Slides


11:45
Wrap-up
Sue Peters, Konstantinos Tsikrikis, Natalie Richer, Bettina Wollesen
Pitfalls, practical considerations, and potential study designs.
Slides



All slides and materials will be made avaliable online after the meeting.




The workshop will be take place at ….



If you are familiar with using a bike, the best way to get around in Maastricht is by bike. Renting a bike is therefore recommended (Stay safe though!). Alternatively the use of the public transport (trams, buses) is recommended. You can check in and out (don’t forget to check out) with your bank card.



The meeting is organized by Julius and …
